lift up mine hand. This phrase may signify the Lord's lifting his right arm in covenant, stretching forth his hand to accomplish his work, or perhaps reaching out to invite the Gentiles to come unto him (5:26; 13:2; see Gen. 14:22; Deut. 32:39-40).

Gentiles. Gentiles are all those who are not of Israel, with Israel being either the literal descendants of Jacob or those who have come spiritually unto the God of Jacob.

standard. A standard is a flag or ensign that serves as a rallying point around which people may gather. The scriptures define the standard as God's words (specifically, the Book of Mormon; 2 Ne. 29:2), the everlasting covenant (D&C 45:9), the great Zion of the last days (D&C 64:41-43), and the light of the righteous or the Church and its faithful members (D&C 115:3-5). Overall, the standard is the true gospel and church of Jesus Christ (5:26; 11:10-12; 62:10; Zech. 9:16).
